page.title: 11The Stud Farm
page.content: The{Stud Farm}was purchased after the Second World War by the nearby {Moulton College of Agriculture.} It was originally built for Captain Drummond, a friend of the Duke of Windsor, as a model farm for horse breeding during the 193O's. Today the farm has{158 Friesian {dairy cows.}Winter housing is provided for the cows in a covered yard, and the herd is milked through a 16 point herring-bone parlour. A{pig}herd consisting of{1OO Large {White and Landrace crossbred sows}are housed in modern buildings which include a farrowing pen. Food for the pigs, using barley grown in the surrounding fields, is prepared and stored in a barn. The farm also has a Dutch barn to store hay and straw and storage units for liquid manure and silage.
